Co-Maker.definition: one of two or more persons who sign an instrument to indicate a promise to pay a financial obligation NOTE

1.1: one of two or more persons who sign an instrument to indicate a promise to pay a financial obligation
1.note: Any co-maker may be sued for the entire amount of the indebtedness, although a co-maker who is forced to pay more than his or her share may seek contribution from the other co-makers.
